title:
Lightweight Decentralized Neural Network-Based Strategies for
  Multi-Robot Patrolling
authors: James C. Ward, Ryan McConville, Edmund R. Hunt
abstract:
The problem of decentralized multi-robot patrol has previously been
approached primarily with hand-designed strategies for minimization of
'idlenes' over the vertices of a graph-structured environment. Here we present
two lightweight neural network-based strategies to tackle this problem, and
show that they significantly outperform existing strategies in both idleness
minimization and against an intelligent intruder model, as well as presenting
an examination of robustness to communication failure. Our results also
indicate important considerations for future strategy design.
